flawed_nl_solution:
The classes in the pack cost $7.5 each because 75 / 10 = <<75/10=7.5>>7.5
An additional class costs $10 because 7.5 x (1 +(1/3)) = <<7.5*(1+(1/3))=10.0>>10.0
She buys 3 extra classes because 13 - 10 = <<13-10=3>>3
Her three additional classes cost $30.0 because 3 x 10.0 = <<3*10.0=30.0>>30.0
Her total cost is $109.0 because 75 + 30.0 = <<75+30.0=109.0>>109.0

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 105.0, not 109.0. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
